revision.text:
{{TennisEventInfo|2008|Masters Series Monte-Carlo| | date=19 – 27 April | edition=102nd | category=[[ATP Masters Series|Masters Series]] | location=[[Roquebrune-Cap-Martin]], [[France]] | surface=Clay / Outdoor | venue=[[Monte Carlo Country Club]] | champs= {{flagicon|ESP}} [[Rafael Nadal]] {{cite web|title=2008 Monte Carlo Men's Singles draw|url=http://www.atpworldtour.com/en/scores/archive/monte-carlo/410/2008/draws?matchType=singles|website=www.atpworldtour.com|publisher=[[Association of Tennis Professionals]] (ATP)}} | champd= {{flagicon|ESP}} [[Rafael Nadal]] / {{flagicon|ESP}} [[Tommy Robredo]] }} The '''2008 Masters Series Monte-Carlo''' (also known as the ''Masters Series Monte-Carlo presented by ROLEX'' for sponsorship reasons) was a men's [[tennis]] tournament played on [[Clay court|outdoor clay courts]]. It was the 102nd edition of the [[Monte Carlo Masters]], and was part of the [[ATP Masters Series]] of the [[2008 ATP Tour]]. It took place at the [[Monte Carlo Country Club]] in [[Roquebrune-Cap-Martin]], [[France]], near [[Monte Carlo]], [[Monaco]], from 19 April through 27 April 2008. The men's field was headlined by [[List of ATP number 1 ranked players|World No. 1]] and [[2008 Estoril Open|Estoril Open]] winner [[Roger Federer]], [[2008 Miami Masters|Miami]] runner-up and [[2007 Monte Carlo Masters|defending champion]] [[Rafael Nadal]], and [[2008 Australian Open|Australian Open]] and [[2008 Indian Wells Masters|Indian Wells]] titlist [[Novak Djokovic]]. Other notable names in the field were [[2008 Miami Masters|Miami Masters]] champion [[Nikolay Davydenko]], [[2008 Open de Tenis Comunidad Valenciana|Valencia Open]] winner [[David Ferrer]], [[David Nalbandian]], [[Richard Gasquet]] and [[Mikhail Youzhny]]. ==Notable stories== ===Nadal's achievements=== Champion [[Rafael Nadal]] became the first man since [[Anthony Wilding]] in 1914 to win four consecutive titles in [[Monte Carlo Masters|Monte Carlo]], and was therefore the first man to do so in the [[History of tennis#Open era|Open Era]].{{cite news|author=BBC Sport|title=Nadal fights back to beat Federer| url =http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/tennis/7369929.stm|date =2008-04-27| accessdate =2008-04-27|work=BBC News}} Nadal also won the doubles event, forming an unseeded team with [[Tommy Robredo]]. This made him only the second man in [[ATP Masters Series]] history to win both the singles and the doubles events of a tournament, in the same year. The last man to do so was [[Jim Courier]], at the [[1991 Newsweek Champions Cup and the Virginia Slims of Palm Springs|1991 Indian Wells Super 9]].{{cite web|title=Nadal First to Double Up at Masters Series in 17 Years|url=http://www.ontennis.com/news/nadal-first-double-masters-series-17-years|publisher=OnTennis.com|date=28 April 2008}} ===All top seeds in final rounds=== For the second time only in [[ATP Masters Series]] history, the top four seeds ([[Roger Federer]], [[Rafael Nadal]], [[Novak Djokovic]] and [[Nikolay Davydenko]]) all reached the semifinals of the event. The last occurrence of this had taken place at the [[1999 Newsweek Champions Cup and the Evert Cup|1999 Cincinnati Super 9 event]], with [[Pete Sampras]], [[Patrick Rafter]], [[Andre Agassi]] and [[Yevgeny Kafelnikov]] all reaching the final four.{{cite news|author=monte-carlo.masters-series.com|title=Djokovic Sets Star-Studded SF Field| url =http://montecarlo.masters-series.com/1/en/news/newsarticle_1068.asp|date =2008-04-25| accessdate =2008-04-25}} ==Champions== ===Singles=== {{main|2008 Masters Series Monte-Carlo – Singles}} {{flagicon|ESP}} '''[[Rafael Nadal]]''' defeated {{flagicon|SUI}} [[Roger Federer]], 7–5, 7–5 *It was Rafael Nadal's 1st title of the year, and his 24th overall. It was his 1st Masters title of the year, his 10th overall, and his 4th consecutive win at the event. ===Doubles=== {{main|2008 Masters Series Monte-Carlo – Doubles}} {{flagicon|ESP}} '''[[Rafael Nadal]]''' / {{flagicon|ESP}} '''[[Tommy Robredo]]''' defeated {{flagicon|IND}} [[Mahesh Bhupathi]] / {{flagicon|BAH}} [[Mark Knowles]], 6–3, 6–3 ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{official website|http://montecarlotennismasters.com}} *[http://www.atpworldtour.com/en/tournaments/monte-carlo/410/overview Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP) tournament profile]
{{Monte Carlo Masters tournaments}} {{2008 ATP Tour}} {{2008 in tennis}} [[Category:2008 ATP Tour|Monte Carlo Masters]] [[Category:2008 Masters Series Monte-Carlo|*]] [[Category:Monte-Carlo Masters]] [[Category:2008 in Monégasque sport]] [[Category:Monaco stubs]] {{Monaco-stub}}

'''Allt í drasli''' (All in a mess) is the [[Iceland]]ic version of the British television show [[How Clean is Your House?]]. In place of the British hosts, Kim and Aggie, it features Margrét Sigfúsdóttir, a former headmistress of the Housewife School, and Heiðar Jónsson, a beautician.<ref>[http://timarit.is/view_page_init.jsp?pageId=3857030 Allt í drasli úti á landi]. Fréttablaðið (in Icelandic) (192) 18 july 2005. p. 75</ref> As of 2007, Eva Ásrún Albertsdóttir has replaced Heiðar.<ref>[http://timarit.is/view_page_init.jsp?pageId=5753240 Skemmtilegast að sjá hvað fólk verður þakklátt]. Blaðið (in Icelandic) (167) 5 september 2007, p. 38</ref>

{{Infobox song | name = Casanova | cover = Gisela Casanova.jpg | alt = | type = single | artist = [[Gisela (singer)|Gisela]] | album = | released = | format = | recorded = 2007 | studio = | venue = | genre = | length = | label = [[Universal Music Group|Universal]] | writer = [[Dominic McDonough]] | producer = | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Infobox song contest entry | embed=yes | song = {{flagicon|Andorra}} "Casanova" | image = | caption = | year = 2008 | country = Andorra | artist = [[Gisela (singer)|Gisela]] | as = | with = | languages = [[English language|English]], [[Catalan language|Catalan]] | composer = Bam | lyricist = Dominic McDonough | place = | points = | place_semi = 16th | points_semi = 22 | prev = Salvem el món | prev_link = Salvem el món | next = La teva decisió (Get a Life) | next_link = La teva decisió (Get a Life) }} }} '''"Casanova"''' is a song by [[Spain|Spanish]] [[singer]] [[Gisela (singer)|Gisela]]. It was chosen to represent [[Andorra]] in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2008]]. It is sung in [[English language|English]], although it features one line in [[Catalan language|Catalan]]. It was written by Dominic McDonough from the United Kingdom. It competed in the first semi-final on 20 May 2008. As bookies predicted, it failed to get through to the final, placing 16th of 19 entries with 22 points. Although it failed to make it to the final, it still managed success on the music charts reaching #2 in Spain. It was also chosen as a favourite by the [[United Kingdom|British]] commentator [[Caroline Flack]]. The song was succeeded as [[Andorra in the Eurovision Song Contest|Andorran representative]] at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2009|2009 contest]] by [[Susanne Georgi]] with "[[La teva decisió (Get a Life)]]". ==Charts== {|class="wikitable" !align="left"|Chart (2008) !align="center"|Peak
position |- |align="left"|[[Spain|Spain Singles Chart]][http://spanishcharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=Gisela&titel=Casanova&cat=s Spain Singles Chart] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090412040710/http://spanishcharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=Gisela&titel=Casanova&cat=s |date=April 12, 2009 }} |align="center"|2 |- |} ==Track listing== * "Casanova" (Original/Eurovision Version) * "Casanova" (Karaoke Version) ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Eurovision Song Contest 2008}} {{Andorra in the Eurovision Song Contest}} {{Casanova}} [[Category:Eurovision songs of Andorra]] [[Category:Eurovision songs of 2008]] [[Category:2008 songs]] [[Category:Universal Music Group singles]] {{2000s-song-stub}} {{Andorra-stub}} {{Eurovision-stub}}

page.title: Central American Bank for Economic Integration

revision.text:
The '''Central American Bank for Economic Integration''' - CABEI ([https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banco_Centroamericano_de_Integraci%C3%B3n_Econ%C3%B3mica BCIE] in spanish) was founded in 1960. Is an international multilateral development financial institution. Its resources are invested in projects that foster development to reduce poverty and inequality; strengthen regional integration and the competitive insertion of its member countries in the global economy; providing special attention to environmental sustainability. Its headquarters are in [[Tegucigalpa]](Honduras) and has regional offices in [[Guatemala]], [[Honduras]], [[El Salvador]], [[Nicaragua]], [[Costa Rica]] and [[Panama]].
==Mission==
CABEI is a [[multilateral development bank]] (MDB) whose mission<ref name="CABEI_INFO">{{cite web|last1=CABEI|title=Institutional Information|url=https://www.bcie.org/en/about-us/general-information/|website=Central American Bank for Economic Integration|accessdate=31 March 2017}}</ref> is to promote the economic integration and the balanced economic and social development of the Central American region, which includes the founding countries and the non-founding regional countries, attending and aligning itself with the interests of all of its member countries.
==Vision==
CABEI's vision<ref name="CABEI_INFO"/> consists of being the strategic ally of its member countries in the provision of financial solutions that contribute to the creation of employment and improvement of the wellbeing and quality of life of its citizens.
==Members==
*'''Founding countries''': Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador, Nicaragua and Costa Rica. These countries signed the Founding Covenant which establishes the CABEI, in the decision frame adopted by their Governments to promote regional economic integration. *'''Non-founding regional countries''': [[Panama]] and [[Dominican Republic]], which take part in the [[Central American Integration System]] (SICA in its Spanish initials) and are represented before CABEI's Board of Directors and Governors' Assembly. *'''Non-regional countries''': [[Mexico]], [[Taiwan]], [[Argentina]], [[Colombia]] and [[Spain]]. They have deemed important to join CABEI with the aim of having a permanent regional presence, thus enlarging their international projection through supporting founding countries' development. They also have named representatives before CABEI's Board of Directors and Governors' Assembly. *'''Beneficiary countries''': [[Belize]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=CABEI|title=Belize|url=https://www.bcie.org/en/member-countries/regional-non-founding-members/belize/|website=Central American Bank for Economic Integration|publisher=CABEI|accessdate=31 March 2017}}</ref> It has joined the CABEI to receive loans and guarantees, same as regional countries, but, unlike them, Belize has not bought shares of the institution.
Apart from regional countries, Argentina and Colombia enjoy the capacity of receiving CABEI's loans and guarantees.
==Functions==
CABEI is the development bank for Central America, its strategic partner and the main purveyor of resources: by late 2009, it had approved<ref>{{cite book|last1=Rodas-Martini|first1=Pablo et al.|title=Contribución del BCIE al Desarrollo de Centroamérica: 50 Años de Historia|date=December 2010|publisher=CABEI|location=Tegucigalpa, Honduras|isbn=978-99926-665-6-2|page=20|url=http://www19.iadb.org/intal/intalcdi/PE/2011/09275.pdf|accessdate=31 March 2017}}</ref> $14,603.3 millon since its inception for the development of the region
As a regional financing institution, CABEI supports both public and private sectors and specializes in raising and channeling external money to promote investment in its action areas, which are:
* Energy and production infrastructure * Agriculture and rural development * Human development and social infrastructure * Industry, urban development and services for competitiveness * Financial trading and development finance
==Structure==
CABEI's maximum authority is the Governors' Assembly, integrated by Ministers of Economy and central bank Governors of member countries.
Besides, CABEI's Founding Covenant includes other authorities: Directory, as the organ responsible for the Bank's direction; President, elected by the Governors' Assembly; Vice president, elected by the Directory; and other officials deemed necessary for the institution's correct functioning.
==See also== * [[CAF – Development Bank of Latin America]] * [[Central American Integration System]] * [[Inter-American Development Bank]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://www.bcie.org/en/ Central American Bank for Economic Integration] official site
{{International organizations}} {{Pan-Americanism}} {{Trade}}

revision.text:
'''Checkmate''' is a Ghanaian movie that was written and directed by [[Shirley Frimpong Manso]] for Sparrow Productions. It was produced by Ken Attoh, features stars like [[Nadia Buari]], Ekow Blankson and [[Naa Ashorkor]] Mensah Doku and introduced Senanu Gbedawo.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ghanacelebrities.com/2010/03/24/movie-review-shirley-frimpong-manso%E2%80%99s-check-mate-movie/|title=Movie Review: Shirley Frimpong Manso’s CHECK MATE - GhanaCelebrities.Com|date=2010-03-24|work=GhanaCelebrities.Com|access-date=2018-11-10|language=en-US}}</ref>
== Cast == [[Nadia Buari]] – Caroline
Ekow Blankson – Kiki Nelson
Senanu Gbedawo – Kwame
[[Naa Ashorkor]] Mensah Doku – Naana Asante
Ewurama Asante – Elsie Kwansah
Kweku Boateng – Fifi
Khareema Agular – Jessica
[[Kwaku Sintim-Misa]] – Mr Tamakloe<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nollywoodforever.com/checkmate/|title=Checkmate {{!}} Ghana Movie {{!}} Nollywood Forever Movie Reviews|website=nollywoodforever.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-10}}</ref>
== Plot == Kwame, played by Senanu Gbedawo, is a member of the immigration workforce who has political ambitions. He comes into contact with Kiki played by Ekow Blankson, who is a drug kingpin. Kiki initially presents himself as a real estate developer and introduces Kwame to Caroline, who is played by [[Nadia Buari]]. Kwame feels an instant attraction to her and notwithstanding his status as a family man, makes moves and quickly gets her into bed. He ends the relationship when Caroline gets a bit obsessed but she is not ready to put the relationship behind her and threatens to inform his wife and go public with the news of their affair. Kwame's new friends are part of a scheme to move drugs out of the country. The drugs would go through customs smoothly with Kwame involved and to make sure of this, Kiki employs the affair tactic to corner him. Kwame now has to deal with the dilemma of giving in to Kiki's demands or losing his family and political ambitions.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.talkafricanmovies.com/checkmate/|title=CHECKMATE|date=2013-09-12|work=Talk African Movies|access-date=2018-11-10|language=en-US}}</ref>
== References == <references />

revision.text:
{{more footnotes|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox prepared food | name = Chiboust cream | image = | caption = | alternate_name = Crème chiboust | country = [[France]] | region = | creator = | course = | type = [[Custard]] | served = | main_ingredient = [[crème pâtissière]], [[whipped cream]] or [[egg white]]s | variations = | calories = | other = }} '''Crème chiboust''' is a [[crème pâtissière]] (pastry cream) lightened with stiffly beaten [[egg white]]s. Though occasionally using [[whipped cream]] to lighten it, this is traditionally a [[millefeuille]] cream.
Crème chiboust can be flavoured with [[vanilla]], [[orange zest]], or [[liqueur]]s. Mixed with fruit, it becomes [[crème plombières]].
It was supposedly created and developed by the pastry Chef M. Chiboust of the pastry shop that was located on the Paris street [[Rue Saint-Honoré]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Les meilleurs Saint-Honoré de Paris|url=http://blogs.lexpress.fr/styles/bec-sucre-parigot/2013/05/02/les-meilleurs-saint-honore-de-paris/|accessdate=27 August 2016|work=L'Express|date=2 May 2013|language=fr-FR}}</ref>
If gelatin is bloomed and incorporated to the chiboust or ''plombieres'', it can be used as a Bavarian. The chiboust or the plombieres can also double as [[soufflé]] filling, as long as egg whites are the base; the mix will "puff up" and provide a creamy soufflé.
==See also== *[[St. Honoré Cake]]
==References== {{Reflist}} * [http://www.cuisine-french.com/cgi/mdc/l/en/recettes/creme_chiboust.html Cuisine-french.com] Full recipe from French Chef * ''Professional Baking Fifth Edition'', Wayne Gisslen

revision.text:
{{more footnotes|date=August 2016}} {{Infobox newspaper | name = Dagblaðið Vísir | logo = DV logo.png | logo_size = 230px | image = | caption = | type = Daily [[newspaper]] | format = [[Tabloid (newspaper format)|Tabloid]] | owners = Frjáls fjölmiðlun ehf. | editor = Sigurvin Ólafsson, Kristjón Kormákur Guðjónsson | staff = | foundation = 1981 | headquarters = Tryggvagata 11
101 [[Reykjavík]] | ISSN = 1021-8254 | website = {{URL|http://www.dv.is}} }} '''''DV''''' ('''''Dagblaðið Vísir''''') is a [[tabloid (newspaper format)|tabloid]] newspaper in [[Iceland]] published by DV ehf. It came into existence in 1981{{cite web|url=http://sul-sfx.stanford.edu/sfxlcl41?url%5Fver=Z39.88-2004&ctx%5Fver=Z39.88-2004&ctx%5Fenc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&rfr%5Fid=info:sid/sfxit.com:opac%5F856&url%5Fctx%5Ffmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:ctx&sfx.ignore%5Fdate%5Fthreshold=1&rft.object%5Fid=1000000000753184&svc%5Fval%5Ffmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:sch%5Fsvc& |title=Find it at Stanford (SFX Services) |publisher=Sul-sfx.stanford.edu |date=1980-09-27 |accessdate=2016-08-14}} when two formerly independent newspapers, [[Vísir]] and [[Dagblaðið]], merged.{{cite web|url=http://timarit.is/view_page_init.jsp?pageId=1548795 |title=Öllum sagt upp í Blaðaprenti |publisher=''[[Morgunblaðið]]'' |date=1981-11-29 |accessdate=2017-07-26}}{{cite web|url=http://timarit.is/view_page_init.jsp?pubId=255 |title=Sameinað og stærra blað á markaðin |publisher=''[[Dagblaðið Vísir]]'' |date=1981-11-26 |accessdate=2017-07-26}} ''DV'' also has an online publication at DV.is. It was one of the biggest newspapers in Iceland early on and at one point had a 64% readership in Iceland. In the [[nineties]] its readership started to dwindle and in 2003 its publisher was decleared bankrupt. It was resurrected a week later by the publisher of [[Fréttablaðið]]. In 2006 it was changed from a daily newspaper into a weekly one. Since then it has changed publishers regularly and in 2018 its publisher, DV ehf., went bankrupt. Its assets were bought by a new publisher, {{Proper name|Frjáls fjölmiðlun ehf}}.{{cite news|author1=Brynjólfur Þór Guðmundsson|title=235 milljóna króna kröfur í þrotabú DV|url=http://www.ruv.is/frett/235-milljona-krona-krofur-i-throtabu-dv|accessdate=24 May 2018|work=[[RÚV]]|date=24 May 2018|language=Icelandic}} The paper has changed dramatically since its inception. Today it is published weekly and focuses mainly on sensational crime stories, astrology, and domestic and foreign celebrity news. Its editorial policy has sparked public controversies in Iceland. == Report of the Special Investigation Commission == In the [[The Report of the Althingi Special Investigation Commission|report of the Special Investigation Commission]] that was formed by [[Alþingi]], ''DV'' was specially noted as almost the only newspaper in Iceland that questioned the Icelandic banks.{{cite web|url=https://www.rna.is/media/skjol/RNABindi8.pdf |title=Aðdragandi og orsakir falls íslensku bankanna 2008 og tengdir atburðir |author=Rannsóknarnefnd Alþingis |publisher=''[[Althing]]'' |date=2010-04-10 |accessdate=2017-07-26}} As a result, the paper acquired broader readership. == Previous controversy == In January 2006, ''DV'' ran a cover story claiming that former elementary school teacher Gísli Hjartarson had sexually abused two or more boys in his home town of [[Ísafjörður]], Northwest Iceland.{{cite web|url=http://timarit.is/view_page_init.jsp?pageId=5543577 |title=Heimakennari kærður fyrir að nauðga piltum |publisher=''[[Dagblaðið Vísir]]'' |date=2006-01-10 |accessdate=2017-07-26}} Hjartarson, who had not been charged with the abuse, committed suicide the same day{{cite web|url=http://www.visir.is/g/2013130129678/strakarnir-i-isafjardarmalinu-stiga-fram-thad-snerist-allt-um-helvitis-dv-og-aumingja-madurinn- |title=Strákarnir í Ísafjarðarmálinu stíga fram: "Það snérist allt um helvítis DV og aumingja maðurinn" |publisher=''[[Vísir.is]]'' |date=2013-01-22 |accessdate=2017-07-26}} and cited the coming news coverage as his reason in a letter he left for his family, although he did not name ''DV'' specifically.{{cite web|url=http://timarit.is/view_page_init.jsp?issId=350054&pageId=5543697 |title=Nefndi ekki DV sem ástæðu|publisher=''[[Dagblaðið Vísir]]'' |date=2006-01-13 |accessdate=2017-07-26}} This tragedy caused popular uproar against ''DV'' with 30 thousand people (about 10% of the Icelandic population) signing an online petition demanding a new editorial policy. The editors were forced to resign. On 4 June 2008, ''DV'' reported that The State Committee of Compensations had paid compensation to two boys in this case.{{cite web|url=http://timarit.is/view_page_init.jsp?pageId=6508379 |title=Kynferðisbrotin teljast óupplýst |publisher=''[[Dagblaðið Vísir]]'' |author=Erla Hlynsdóttir |date=2008-06-04 |accessdate=2017-07-26}} ==See also== * [[List of newspapers in Iceland]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.dv.is/}} [[Category:1981 establishments in Iceland]] [[Category:Media in Reykjavík]] [[Category:Newspapers published in Iceland]] [[Category:Publications established in 1981]] {{iceland-newspaper-stub}}

revision.text:
'''Bruce Dale Sommers''' (November 26, 1943 – August 24, 2012), known by his nickname '''"The Truckin' Bozo"''', was an [[Americans|American]] [[radio personality]], best known for his long-running [[country music]] show geared toward [[truck driver]]s.<ref name="RIP20120824">{{cite web|first=John|last=Kiesewetter|url=http://cincinnati.com/blogs/tv/2012/08/24/rip-dale-truckin-bozo-sommers|title=RIP: Dale ‘Truckin Bozo’ Sommers|work=TV and Media Blog|publisher=Cincinnati.com|date=August 24, 2012|accessdate=2012-08-24|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120827023251/http://cincinnati.com/blogs/tv/2012/08/24/rip-dale-truckin-bozo-sommers/|archivedate=August 27, 2012|df=}}</ref> Sommers hosted the overnight show from [[Cincinnati, Ohio]]-based [[clear-channel station]]<!--Is this a FCC "clear-channel" category station, or did it mean "owned by Clear Channel Comms" (To answer that question, both, but probably the former.) (Additional answer: WLW is both an FCC clear-channel station, and owned by Clear Channel.) --> [[WLW]] from 1984 to 2004, and it was carried by a small network of similarly high-powered stations across the United States. Sommers discontinued playing music on his nightly show, focusing on general and truck news, and talk from his listeners. Sommers announced his retirement from radio in 2004, but [[XM Satellite Radio]] was successful in getting him to do an afternoon truck show, which aired on [[Sirius Satellite Radio]] and XM from 4 PM to 7 PM [[Eastern time zone|Eastern time]]. Sommers retired from XM/Sirius on June 21, 2012, only to return for the last time on July 16, 2012.
==Biography==
===History=== Born Glen Council<ref name="RIP20120824"/> in [[Humboldt, Tennessee]], Sommers moved to Cincinnati with his family at the age of 15. The next year (1959), be began working for WAEF. Sommers worked for other local radio stations in Cincinnati, as well as in [[Evansville, Indiana|Evansville]], [[Indianapolis]], [[Seattle]], [[San Diego]], [[Miami]], and [[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City]], before settling back at WLW in 1984.<ref name="E20040422"/> His nickname '''"The Truckin' Bozo"''' reportedly came from his former boss at WLW, [[Randy Michaels]]. During a station remodeling, Michaels saw Sommers kick a wall. Unfortunately, its supports had been removed and it came crashing down across a desk, prompting Michaels to call Sommers “a [[Bozo the Clown|bozo]].”<ref name="E20040422"/> Sommers retired from WLW in 2003 but shortly thereafter assumed work at XM, joining the Open Road channel in a daytime slot. Sommers would remain with the channel through its merger with Sirius's [[Road Dog Trucking]] channel up until shortly before his death.
===Catching a robber=== "The Bozo" made national headlines when he helped to catch a robber at a [[convenience store]] in [[Camilla, Georgia]]. Sommers was talking live on the air with regular caller Linda Driskill, known as "Mississippi Lady" to listeners, when he heard Driskill admonish someone not to come behind her counter. She then hung up the phone. Sommers was concerned for her safety, so he called the Camilla police (who knew Driskill from Sommers' show). The police responded to Driskill's store and quickly apprehended the robber.<ref>{{cite news|first=John|last=Kiesewetter|publisher=[[The Cincinnati Enquirer]]|title=WLW turns 80|url=http://www.enquirer.com/editions/2002/03/17/tem_wlw_700_turns_80.html|date=2002-03-17|accessdate=2007-02-20}}</ref>
===Comments on Mexicans=== Sommers has raised some controversy among Mexican truckers for his apparent negative comments on the radio regarding cross-border trucking. He was often heard supporting bans on Mexican trucks in the United States.<ref name=MTO20080115>{{cite web|first=|title=Trucking Bozo spreading more fear and hate!|url=http://mexicotrucker.com/trucking-bozo-spreading-more-fear-and-hate|publisher=Mexico Trucker Online|accessdate=2012-08-24|date=January 15, 2008}}</ref>
==Family and health== Sommers was married to Sharon "Lumpy" Cox Sommers for 35 years. Sharon ran a travel agency until May 2004 and retired from the travel business. She died Aug. 10, 2016, at her home in Mason, Ohio. <ref>"[http://www.landlinemag.com/Story.aspx?StoryID=31731#.V64XOlsrJpg Sharon 'Lumpy' Sommers dies unexpectedly]" Land Line Magazine, Aug. 11, 2016.</ref>Dale and Sharon spent approximately nine months a year in Florida and the summer months in Cincinnati. Sommers had a studio in his Florida home and also in his Cincinnati home so he could continue working from both locations.
Sommers is survived by his wife, sons Steve Sommers (born c. 1965; host of ''[[America's Trucking Network]]''), media executive [[Sean Compton]], David Sommers (who runs the travel business founded by his mother), Kevin Sommers, and Jason Sommers, stepson Brian Mitchell, and his daughter, Krissie Sommers Kastle who currently resides in Indiana. He had 19 grandchildren and four great-grandchildren.<ref name="LLM20120824">{{cite web|last=Soendker|first=Sandi|title=Breaking News: Trucking radio icon Dale Sommers signs off|url=http://www.landlinemag.com/Story.aspx?StoryID=24071|publisher=Land line magazine|date=August 24, 2012|accessdate=2012-08-24}}</ref>
In later years, Sommers was diagnosed with [[Addison's disease]] and insulin-dependent diabetes, which factored into his retirement from terrestrial radio.<ref name="E20040422">{{cite news|url=http://www.enquirer.com/editions/2004/04/22/loc_bozo22.html|title=Truckin' Bozo's buggin' out for good|last=Johnston|first=John|date=April 22, 2004|work=The Cincinnati Enquirer|publisher=Gannett Co. Inc|accessdate=2009-01-25}}</ref> Despite his health difficulties, he maintained his satellite radio show until shortly before his death.
==Death== On the morning of August 24, 2012, Sommers died in a [[hospice]] facility near his home in [[Hernando, Florida]] at the age of 68.<ref name="LLM20120824"/>
==References== {{Reflist}} {{refbegin}} *{{cite news|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-123124906.html|title=Sommers now trucking on XM |last=Bird |first=Rick |date=October 11, 2004 |work=The Cincinnati Enquirer |publisher=Gannett Co. Inc|accessdate=2009-01-25}} {{refend}}
==External links== *[http://www.thebozo.com The Truckin' Bozo official site] (Site is "retired") *{{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090530101419/http://www.xmradio.com/onxm/channelbio.xmc?ch=171 |date=May 30, 2009 |title=Dale Sommers on XM Open Road }}

[[File:Edward W Nelson 1911.jpg|thumb|upright=1.2|Nelson testing thermometers during the [[Terra Nova Expedition]] in 1911]] '''Edward W Nelson''' (1883–1923) was an [[invertebrate]] [[zoologist]] and [[polar explorer]]. He worked at the [[Marine Biological Association of the United Kingdom]] (MBA) in Plymouth and in 1910, in association with E. J. Allen, developed a simple method for culturing [[phytoplankton]].
==Polar expedition==
In 1910, he joined the [[British Antarctic Expedition, 1910–13|British Antarctic Expedition]] (popularly known as "The Terra Nova Expedition") led by [[Robert Falcon Scott]], and served as a biologist. He took part in a [[Sledding|sledging]] journey to "One Ton Depot", carrying food supplies for the returning polar party. He also conducted tidal observations while at [[Cape Evans]] and was later awarded the [[Polar Medal]]. He has been commemorated with "Nelson Cliff" at the west side of the [[Simpson Glacier]] (71°14′S, 168°42′E).
==Later career==
On his return from the Antarctic, Nelson worked as Senior [[Naturalist]] at the laboratory in Plymouth, taking leave to fight with the [[British 63rd (Royal Naval) Division]] in the [[Battle of Gallipoli|Gallipoli campaign]], then later in the trenches of France. In 1920 the [[Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food]] approached the MBA to propose that the Association undertake the manufacture of a large number of "Drift Bottles", to be used in tracking the movement of the waters of the [[North Sea]]. By this time, Nelson was the Scientific Superintendent of the "[[Scottish Fisheries Protection Agency|Fisheries Board for Scotland]]", and wrote a paper on the manufacture of the drift bottles for the Association's Journal. He committed suicide by lethal injection in 1923 when he was only 39. An inquest into his death was reported in The Times newspaper.{{clarify|date=December 2009}}
==Sources and further reading==
*"British [[List of polar explorers|polar exploration]] and research: a historical and medallic record with biographies 1818–1999" by [[Lieutenant Colonel]] Neville W. Poulsom and [[Rear Admiral]] John A.L. Myres, Savannah Publications London (2000) *"Bergy Bits: The Newsletter of the Friends of the Antarctic", No. 28 April 2009 *"One Hundred Years of Marine Research at Plymouth" in the [[Journal of the Marine Biological Association of the UK]] (1987), 67, 465–506.[[Cambridge University Press]]. *"On the Manufacture of Drift Bottles" in the Journal of the Marine Biological Association of the UK (1922) New Series, 12:700–716 Cambridge University Press.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Nelson, Edward W}} [[Category:1883 births]] [[Category:1923 deaths]] [[Category:Explorers of Antarctica]] [[Category:Antarctic scientists]]

'''Eubulus''' ({{lang-grc-gre|Εὔβουλος}}, ''Euboulos'') was an [[Athens|Athenian]] "[[Middle Comedy|Middle Comic]]" [[poet]], victorious six times at the [[Lenaia]], first probably in the late 370s or 360s BC (''IG'' II2 2325.144; just before Ephippus)
According to the ''[[Suda]]'' (test. 1), which dates him to the 101st [[Olympiad]] (i.e. 376/2) and identifies him as "on the border between the Middle and the [[Old Comedy]]", he produced 104 comedies and won six victories at the [[Lenaia]]. An obscure notice in a ''[[scholia|scholium]]'' on [[Plato]] (test. 4) appears to suggest that some of his plays were staged by [[Aristophanes]]’ son [[Philippus (son of Aristophanes)|Philippus]]. He attacked [[Philocrates]], [[Callimedon]], [[Cydias]], and [[Dionysius I of Syracuse|Dionysius]] the tyrant of Syracuse.
Eubulus's plays were chiefly about mythological subjects and often parodied the tragic playwrights, especially [[Euripides]].
==Surviving Titles and Fragments== 150 fragments (including three ''dubia'') of his comedies survive, along with fifty-eight titles:
{{div col|colwidth=22em}} *''Ancylion'' *''Anchises'' *''Amaltheia'' *''Anasozomenoi'' ("Men Who Were Trying To Get Home Safe") *''Antiope'' *''Astytoi'' ("Impotent Men") *''Auge'' *''Bellerophon'' *''Ganymede'' *''Glaucus'' *''Daedalus'' *''Danae'' *''Deucalion'' *''Dionysius'' *''Dolon'' *''Eirene'' ("Peace") *''Europa'' *''Echo'' *''Ixion'' *''Ion'' *''Kalathephoroi'' ("Basket-Bearers") *''Campylion'' *''Katakollomenos'' ("The Man Who Was Glued To the Spot") *''Cercopes'' *''Clepsydra'' *''Korydalos'' ("The Lark") *''Kybeutai'' ("Dice-Players") *''Lakones'' ("Spartans") or ''Leda'' *''Medea'' *''Mylothris'' ("The Mill-Girl") *''Mysians'' *''Nannion'' *''Nausicaa'' *''Neottis'' *''Xuthus'' *''Odysseus'' or ''Panoptai'' ("Men Who See Everything") *''Oedipus'' *''Oenimaus'' or ''Pelops'' *''Olbia'' *''Orthannes'' *''Pamphilus'' *''Pannychis'' ("The All-Night Festival") *''Parmeniscus'' *''Pentathlos'' ("The Pentathlete") *''Plangon'' *''Pornoboskos'' ("The Pimp") *''Procris'' *''Prosousia or Cycnus'' *''Semele or Dionysus'' *''Skyteus'' ("The Shoemaker") *''Stephanopolides'' ("Female Garland-Vendors") *''Sphingokarion'' ("Sphinx-Carion") *''Titans'' *''Tithai'' or ''Titthe'' ("Wet-Nurses" or Wet-Nurse") *''Phoenix'' *''Charites'' ("The Graces") *''Chrysilla'' *''Psaltria'' ("The Harp-Girl") {{div col end}}
The standard edition of the testimonia and fragments is found in Kassel-Austin, ''Poetae Comici Graeci'' Vol V; Kock numbers are outdated and should no longer be used. [[Richard L. Hunter]] offers a careful study of Eubulus’ career and the fragments of his plays in ''Eubulus: The Fragments'' (Cambridge, 1983).{{fact|date=February 2018}} {{greece-stub}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Eubulus}} [[Category:4th-century BC Athenians]] [[Category:Ancient Greek dramatists and playwrights]] [[Category:4th-century BC writers]] [[Category:Middle Comic poets]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] [[Category:Year of death unknown]]

{{Infobox song contest entry | song = {{flagicon|Netherlands}} "Het is een wonder" | image = | caption = | year = 1981 | country = Netherlands | artist = Henriëtte Willems | as = Linda Williams | with = | language = Dutch | languages = | composer = Cees de Wit | lyricist = Bart van de Laar | conductor = Rogier van Otterloo | place = 9th | points = 51 | lyrics = [http://www.diggiloo.net/?1981nl from Diggiloo Thrush] | prev = Amsterdam | prev_link = Amsterdam (Maggie MacNeal song) | next = Jij en ik | next_link = Jij en ik }} '''"Het is een wonder"''' ("It's a miracle") was the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] entry in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1981]], performed in [[Dutch language|Dutch]] by [[Linda Williams (singer)|Linda Williams]].
The song is a ballad, with Williams singing about the effect that meeting her lover has had on her. She explains that she had not previously experienced happiness, but now she is surrounded by it. Williams also recorded an English-language version of her entry, under the title "I am the Lady".
The song was performed eleventh on the night, following [[Spain]]'s [[Bacchelli]] with "[[Y sólo tú]]" and preceding [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]'s [[Sheeba]] with "[[Horoscopes (song)|Horoscopes]]". At the close of voting, it had received 51 points, placing 9th in a field of 20.
It was succeeded as [[Netherlands in the Eurovision Song Contest|Dutch representative]] at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1982|1982 Contest]] by [[Bill van Dijk]] with "[[Jij en ik]]".
==Sources and external links== * [http://www.eurovision.tv/page/history/by-year/contest?event=297 Official Eurovision Song Contest, history by year, 1981] * [http://www.diggiloo.net/?1981nl Detailed info and lyrics, Diggiloo Thrush, "Het is een wonder".]
{{Eurovision Song Contest 1981}}

{{italic title}} [[File:HuojuvatKeulat.jpg|thumb|1947 edition (publ. [[Werner Söderström Osakeyhtiö|WSOY]])]] '''''Huojuvat Keulat''''' is a 1946 poetry collection by Finnish poet [[Aaro Hellaakoski]]. The poems consist of short verses reflecting on [[nature]] and [[travel]] through the landscape.
==Extract== {{cquote|''A race of sucklers, with gnashing jaws'',
''you finished the tale of the dinosaurus'',
''but you'll never rise above the earth''
''as we: you're dust and soil and dearth'',
an organised pack with famished maws. -
''Maybe you'll rise from your mud one day''.
''How much, it's up to you say''."
(from 'The Last Dinosaur' in Huojuvat keulat, 1946)}}
==External links and sources== * {{Books and Writers |id=aarohell |name=Huojuvat Keulat}}

revision.text: '''Kyrgyzstan Time''' (KGT)is the [[time zone]] of [[Kyrgyzstan]].{{cite web|title=KGT – Kyrgyzstan Time (Standard Time)|url=http://www.timeanddate.com/time/zones/kgt|website=Time and Date|accessdate=20 June 2015}} It is +6:00 hrs ahead of [[Universal Coordinated Time]] ([[UTC+6]]). Kyrgyzstan does not observe [[daylight saving time]]. ==IANA time zone database== Data for Kyrgyzstan directly from [[List of tz database time zones|zone.tab]] of the [[tz database|IANA time zone database]]. {{Infobox University|name = Private University in the Principality of Liechtenstein (UFL) | image_name = Logo_UFL_web.jpg | motto = "Kluge Köpfe denken voraus" | established = 2000 | type = [[University]] | dean = Dr. phil. [[ PhD Program in Medical Sciences]]
[[PhD Program in Law]] |colors= {{color box|blue}}{{color box|red}}{{color box|yellow}} [[Blue]], [[Red]] and [[Yellow]] | website = [http://www.ufl.li/ ufl.li] }} The '''Private University in the Principality of Liechtenstein''' (German: '''Private Universität im Fürstentum Liechtenstein (UFL)''') is one of the four centers for higher education in the [[Principality]] of [[Liechtenstein]]. It focuses on two main fields of study. These are Medical Sciences and Law. The university is located in Triesen. The university has partnerships with over 20 other institutions in the rest of the world. == History == The university was founded in 2000 as ''University for Human Sciences in the Principality of Liechtenstein'' (German: ''Universität für Humanwissenschaften im Fürstentum Liechtenstein''). In 2007 the [[Law School]] was established and the university was renamed. Besides numerous law courses, the university still has its focus on medical research. It offers doctoral courses in [[medical science]], which are eligible for candidates with master's degrees in [[medicine]], [[medical technology]], [[biomedical engineering]], [[biology]] and related disciplines. == Study programs == [[Image:Bild UFL web.jpg|thumb|Private University in the Principality of Liechtenstein]] * [[PhD|Doctoral programs]] in [[Medical Sciences]], students are awarded the German PhD equivalent ''Dr. scient. med.'' * [[PhD|Doctoral programs]] in [[Law]], students are awarded the German PhD equivalent ''Dr. iur.'' ==External links== * the official website: [http://www.ufl.li Private University in the Principality of Liechtenstein] * [http://www.liechtenstein.li/en/ Fürstentum Liechtenstein] {{Europe topic|List of universities in}} {{coord|47.1082|N|9.5266|E|source:wikidata|display=title}} [[Category:Education in Liechtenstein]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 2000]] {{Liechtenstein-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2013}} {{Unreferenced|date=April 2017}} {{Infobox radio station | name = RDP Internacional | image = RdpInternacional_2016.png | image_size = 200px | area = International
([[Europe]], [[Africa]], [[South America]], [[North America]]) | airdate = | frequency = | format = Ethnic/International | owner = [[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]] | website = [http://www.rtp.pt/radio/ RDP Internacional] }} '''RDP Internacional - Rádio Portugal''' (abbreviated as '''RDPi'''), is an international radio broadcasting station of [[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]]. It aims at overseas Portuguese communities in [[Europe]], [[Africa]], [[South America]], [[North America]], India/[[Middle East]] as well as [[East Timor]]. ==Overview== [[File:RDP Internacional logo.svg|200px|thumb|right|RDP Internacional logo from 2004 to 2016.]] RDPi is available worldwide via [[satellite]] and [[Internet]], serving most Portuguese-speaking communities in Europe, Africa, North America (United States/ Canada), South America ([[Brazil]]), [[Venezuela]] and India/Middle East. In Díli (East Timor), RDPi broadcasts also on 105.3 FM, but some programmes are also relayed by [[Radio-Televisão Timor Leste|Radio Timor Leste]], together with local broadcasts. RDP International ceased its world shortwave transmissions on 1 June 2011. RTP main shortwave broadcasting centre, known as "CEOC - Centro Emissor de Onda Curta" (lit. SW transmitting centre) was located near Pegões, Portugal, has four 300 kW shortwave transmitters (1 TELEFUNKEN S 4005 and 3 THALES TSW 2300) and four 100 kW transmitters as backup, which served 6 transmitting antennas. Broadcasts to Venezuela and India/Middle East used only 100 kW because of technical limitations: antennas cannot handle powers above 100 kW. Transmissions to Europe, America and Africa used 300 kW. RDPi also used ProFunk GmbH centre in Sines, as part of an agreement made between the Portuguese State and Deutsche Welle; since January 2009, weekend broadcasts from Sines used Digital Radio Mondiale (DRM) targeting central Europe. Although RDP had a radio channel dedicated to Portuguese-speaking Africa countries, [[RDP África]], RDPi covered those countries on shortwave, even in areas not served by RDP África. Nonetheless, some African radios relay some programmes from RDPi, specially Portuguese football games. Some programmes, in particular newscasts and football games broadcast on RDPi and RDP Antena 1 were also relayed on many Portuguese-speaking radios around the world, like Radio Alfa - 98.6 FM [[Paris]] (France) and WJFD (Radio Globo) - 97.3 FM [[Massachusetts]] (United States). ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.rtp.pt/radio/}} {{pt icon}} * [http://www.rtp.pt/play/direto/rdpinternacional RDP Internacional live stream on RTP Play] {{pt icon}} {{Rádio e Televisão de Portugal}} {{coord missing|Portugal}} [[Category:External services (broadcasting)]] [[Category:Radio stations in Brazil]] [[Category:Radio stations in East Timor]] [[Category:Radio stations in Portugal]] [[Category:Portuguese-language radio stations]] [[Category:Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]] {{Europe-radio-station-stub}}

{{Infobox musical artist | name = Randomajestiq | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Belarus]] | genre = [[Electronic music|Electronic]]
[[Techno music|Techno]]
[[House music|House]]
[[Chillout music|Chillout]]
[[Alternative dance]] | years_active = 1993–present | label = [[Gizmo Lab]], [[Collaps]] | associated_acts = | website = [http://www.rmjq.info/ Official Website] | current_members = [[Vladimir Hropov]] | past_members = }} '''Randomajestiq''' is a music project of musician Vladimir Hropov. Hiropov, born in 1976, is a sound designer, composer and producer. In 1993 he started composing [[chiptune]]s on the [[AY-3-8910]] fm-synth chip. With this experience with the [[tracker (music software)|Tracker software]], he then moved to more advanced [[Personal computer|PC]] and current production technologies to experiment with recorded sounds and synthesis. The resulting project, Randomajestiq, then produced a few [[Intelligent dance music|IDM]] albums, which appeared on the [http://www.kahvi.org/ KAHVI], [http://autoplate.org/ THINNER/AUTOPLATE], [http://subsource.de/ SUBSOURCE], [http://kikapu.org/ Kikapu] and [https://web.archive.org/web/20051024165003/http://www.raw42music.com/ RAW42] [[netlabel]]s and in some CD compilations. Today Randomajestiq produces music in almost all [[List of electronic music genres|genres of electronic music]]. Since 2006, Randomajestiq's music has been available on [[iTunes Store]]. == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20071212162155/http://amiestreet.com/randomajestiq Randomajestiq] at [[Amie Street]] * {{discogs artist|artist=Randomajestiq|name=Randomajestiq}} * {{musicbrainz artist|id=cddc1e95-558e-4eb1-a344-c684b9687059|name=Randomajestiq}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Electronic music groups]] [[Category:Belarusian music]] {{electronic-band-stub}} {{Belarus-stub}}
